byline.original: Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: As the deadline approached for recommending permanent and temporary headquarters for the United Nations Organization, the sevenman site-inspection committee set in motion yesterday machinery that pointed to the eventual selection of a site in New...
docs.lead_paragraph: As the deadline approached for recommending permanent and temporary headquarters for the United Nations Organization, the sevenman site-inspection committee set in motion yesterday machinery that pointed to the eventual selection of a site in New York State, probably an area surrounding the Franklin Delano Roosevelt estate in Hyde Park.

headline.main: HYDE PARK AS SITE FOR UNO INDICATED; New York Believed Likely to Be Interim Center--Dewey Meets Subcommittee Friday

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, Jan. 30--Juan D. Peron, candidate for the Argentine Presidency, said flatly today that he would not attempt a coup, as has been rumored here, and that the elections would be held on Feb. 24 as scheduled.
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, Jan. 30--Juan D. Peron, candidate for the Argentine Presidency, said flatly today that he would not attempt a coup, as has been rumored here, and that the elections would be held on Feb. 24 as scheduled.
docs.abstract: Peron int; denies he will attempt coup; says elections will be held as scheduled; charges opposition with seeking to break up elections; says US Embassy is involved in smuggling arms across Plata River; deplores Asst Sec Braden attitude

headline.main: PERON SAYS WE AID ARMS SMUGGLING; Presidential Candidate Links U.S. Embassy With Running of Guns Into Argentina

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES (By Wireless). AMONG the officers who, on June 4,  1943, moved on Buenos Aires from the near-by military base of Campo de Mayo and pushed over President Ramon S. Castillo's defenseless, ineffectual administration was a certain Col. Juan...
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES (By Wireless). AMONG the officers who, on June 4, 1943, moved on Buenos Aires from the near-by military base of Campo de Mayo and pushed over President Ramon S. Castillo's defenseless, ineffectual administration was a certain Col. Juan Domingo Peron.

headline.main: Portrait of a Rabble-Rouser; Colonel Peron was unknown to Argentines in 1943; today he evokes either loathing or fierce loyalty.
